title: Wall Street slips on impeachment uncertainty
text:
FILE PHOTO: Traders work on the floor at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, U.S., September 18, 2019. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid

NEW YORK (Reuters) - U.S. stocks slipped on Thursday as the release of a whistleblower report tied to the Democrats’ impeachment move against President Donald Trump kept uncertainty high, while trade comments from China’s top diplomat helped to limit losses.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average .DJI fell 76.26 points, or 0.28%, to 26,894.45, the S&P 500 .SPX lost 7 points, or 0.23%, to 2,977.87 and the Nasdaq Composite .IXIC dropped 46.72 points, or 0.58%, to 8,030.66.
description: U.S. stocks slipped on Thursday as the release of a whistleblower report tied to the Democrats' impeachment move against President Donald Trump kept uncertainty high, while trade comments from China's top diplomat helped to limit losses.
